name: Raihan Nayum
journalist_body_of_work: Don't know
description_of_attack: The reporter was killed when a mob turned violent after a Hindu temple and its deity, Maa Kaali, were damaged by protesters. (As reported in Asia Sentinel)

name: Kamlesh Jain
journalist_body_of_work: Journalist Kamlesh Jain was a Hindi journalist, writing for Indore based Hindu Daily Nai Dunai. Sometime before he was killed, he had written an article on illicit trade of Alcohol following which he received death threats.
description_of_attack: The journalist was shot by two men riding a bike while he was working in his office at Pipliya Mandi, filing stories.
motive_of_attack:
According to a Times of India report, one of the main accused Sudhir Jain's  widowed sister-in-law  was to get married to Kamlesh. To avoid sharing the property with his brother's wife, he planned to kill Kamlesh.
The co-accused Dheeraj Agarwal held a grudge against Jain as Jain's reporting had led to his fathers loss in one of the municipal council elections. Thus, giving him reason to be a part of the murder.

name: Thounaojam Brajamani Singh
journalist_body_of_work: Founded Manipur News, the premier english news publication in Manipur
description_of_attack: Scooterists with covered faces shot and escaped

name: Paritosh Pandey
journalist_body_of_work: Focused on organised crime in the city.
description_of_attack: Assailant entered victim's apartment at 10:30 pm

name: Yambem Meghajit Singh
journalist_body_of_work: Worked as a chief correspondent for Northeast Vision. Colleagues said his work was fairly uncontroversial
description_of_attack: Yamben was found beaten with bamboos, with a bullet in his hear

name: Mohammed Muslimuddin
journalist_body_of_work: Muslimuddin wrote about corruption and criminal activities, including illegal drug trade.
accussed_names: Qutubur Rahman, Mohammed Tuta Miyan and Mohhamed Joynul Haque
description_of_attack: Muslimuddin was on his way on a bicycle from Morajhar bazaar to his residence at Barpukhuri, when the group, numbering about six persons attacked him with lethal weapons. He died on the way to hospital.
motive_of_attack: He had written a series of reports about criminal-politician nexus in the Hojai sub-division of the district, acording to the Indian Express report.

name: Dwijamani Singh
journalist_body_of_work: He was covering a protest in Imphal, the capital of Manipur state
description_of_attack: Dwijamani Singh was shot dead by police while he was covering a protest.

name: Rajesh Mishra
journalist_body_of_work: According to news reports, Mishra, had written articles on alleged financial irregularities in local schools.
description_of_attack: Assailants hit Mishra on the head with an iron rod while he was at a public tea stall.

name: Prahlad Goala
journalist_body_of_work: Prahlad took up his assignment as a rural reporter for the daily in August 2004, says The Hoot. He had written about the corruption in the forest department, the timber mafia and man-elephant conflict
accussed_names: K. Zaman Jinnah, a forest range officer
description_of_attack: Goala was riding a motorcycle near his home when he was apparently rammed by a truck. When police arrived at the scene, they found that Goala had been stabbed several times.
motive_of_attack: Goala had written a series of articles on corruption in the Assamese-language daily Asomiya Khabar that linked local forestry service officials to timber smuggling. The forest ranger used to threaten Prahlad  Goala for his reports.

name: Umesh Rajput
journalist_body_of_work: According to report, Rajput had written about corruption and exploitation of tribal communities.
description_of_attack: Two masked gunmen on motorcycles shot dead Rajput outside his home.

name: Indra Mohan Hakasam
journalist_body_of_work: He was a correspondent in the organisation
description_of_attack: Victim was kidnapped from his residence

name: Asiya Jeelani
journalist_body_of_work: Jeelani was monitoring parliamentary elections in Kashmir along with Jammu Kashmir Coalition of Civil Society (JKCCS).
description_of_attack: Asiya Jeelani and a colleague were traveling in Kupwara district to monitor poll proceedings in remote villages of Lolab when their vehicle hit a landmine.

name: Vijay Pratap Singh
journalist_body_of_work: Singh had interviewed Nand Gopal Gupta, the minister for institutional finance.
description_of_attack: Explosives concealed in a moped outside the minister Nand Gopal Gupta's home were detonated when Singh was interviewing the minister.

name: Parmanand Goyal
journalist_body_of_work: Wrote on political figures
description_of_attack: Assailants visited home, threatened and wounded Goyal
motive_of_attack: Goyal's son overheard assailants telling him not to write about a certain political figure

name: Anil Mazumdar
journalist_body_of_work: Agence France Presse reported that Mazumdar's paper had taken a stand of supporting negotiations between the government and the United Liberation Front of Asom.
description_of_attack: Assailants shot dead Mazumdar outside his home.

name: Veeraboina Yadagiri
journalist_body_of_work: Yadagiri, a veteran journalist and staff correspondent for the local, Telugu-language daily Andhra Prabha wrote about crime and corruption.
accussed_names: Lakshminarayana Goud, Sirimalle Srinivas, Venkatesh Chauhan, and Nagi Reddy
description_of_attack: Yadagiri was accompanied home by a few men after a meeting with people involved in the toddy trade. Lakshminarayana Goud, one of those accompanying Yadagiri, stabbed him multiple times before fleeing the scene.
motive_of_attack: Yadagiri had written a series of articles on the dangers of consuming toddy and the involvement of local politicians in the toddy trade, according to CPJ. He had filed a complaint with the police about death threats he had received.

name: Dilip Mohapatra
journalist_body_of_work: Wrote on the timber and narcotics mafia
description_of_attack: He went missing 08 November, and was found with his hands and feet tied and a wounded head

name: Parvaz Mohammed Sultan
journalist_body_of_work: Sultan worked in Al Safa, then a leading Urdu daily published from Srinagar and also wrote analytical pieces for Urdu weekly Chattan. In 2000, he started his own wire service NAFA.
description_of_attack: Two men entered Sultan's office and after a brief conversation with Sultan, one of the men shot him in the head, according to reports. The Associated Press (AP) reported that the killer used a pistol with a silencer.

name: Bhola Nath Masoom
journalist_body_of_work: Reported on politics and business
description_of_attack: Was shot by two suspected militants near his home in the town of Rajpura. He died the same day.

name: Arun Narayan Dekate
journalist_body_of_work: Working on gambling rackets and stories on "Satta" kingpins
description_of_attack: Four assailants stoned Narayan Dekate, leaving him severely injured
motive_of_attack: Likely tip-off to the police of "Satta" kingpin Dhampal Bhagat

name: Ramchandra Chhatrapati
journalist_body_of_work: Chhatrapati edited and published a Hindi-language newspaper in Sirsa which extensively covered local issues and also wrote about activities of Dera Sacha Sauda.
description_of_attack: On the night of October 24, 2002, two men riding a motorcycle, claiming to be followers of a religious sect called Dera Sacha Sauda, had shot at Chhatrapati four times from point-blank range.
motive_of_attack: Chhatrapati was targeted for reporting on sexual abuse and other crimes committed at the Dera's compound in Sirsa. He had also published the anonymous complaint of one of the female followers of Ram Rahim Singh.

name: Jagjit Saikia
journalist_body_of_work: Regularly reported on insurgency between rival groups in Assam, insurgents and political organizations
description_of_attack: Was shot multiple times at point blank range

name: Moolchand Yadav
journalist_body_of_work: Yadav worked as a freelance journalist from Jhansi and wrote about local news, including politics and corruption.
description_of_attack: Yadav was shot dead on the street of Jhansi town.
motive_of_attack: CPJ mentions Yadav's colleagues saying that he was murdered at the behest of two powerful landowners angered by his exposés about local corruption.

name: Pradeep Bhatia
journalist_body_of_work: Bhatia had done several photo assignments covering major news events ranging from politics, social issues to conflict.
description_of_attack: An earlier grende blast lured journalists and security forces to the area. It was followed by the detonation of a powerful car bomb within a few feet of the crowd which killed Bhatia.

name: Narendra Dabholkar
journalist_body_of_work: Dabholkar was a campaigner against religious superstition. He wrote in support of legislation to ban exploitative superstitious practices.
description_of_attack: Two unidentified gunmen on motorcycles shot Narendra Dabholkar while he was taking his morning walk.

name: Rakesh Sharma
journalist_body_of_work: Sharma is believed to have reported on illegal gambling operations.
description_of_attack: Sharma was shot by unidentified assailants on a motorcycle.

name: Rajesh Verma
journalist_body_of_work: He was covering communal clashes in Muzaffarnagar.
description_of_attack: Unidentified assailants fatally shot Rajesh Verma while he was covering communal clashes

name: Sai Reddy
journalist_body_of_work: He covered  health, food distribution, corruption, and Maoist insurgents.
description_of_attack: Assailants beat and stabbed Reddy as he left a market in Basaguda village in Bijapur.

name: Tarun Kumar Acharya
journalist_body_of_work: Acharya is believed to have reported on child labour practices at a cashew processing plant.
description_of_attack: Acharya was found with his throat slit and injuries to his chest.

name: MVN Shankar
journalist_body_of_work: Shankar is believed to have reported on the oil mafia.
description_of_attack: Shankar was beaten by unidentified assailants with iron rods while he was returning home.

name: Jagendra Singh
journalist_body_of_work: Singh, is believed to have reported critically on politics and current affairs.
accussed_names: Uttar Pradesh Minister Ram Murti Singh Verma
description_of_attack: Before his death Singh claimed that a police officer had doused him in petrol and set him on fire.

name: Karun Misra
journalist_body_of_work: Misra is believed to have reported on illegal mining.
accussed_names: Rahul Singh, Pawan Singh, Ajay Singh, Sandeep Singh and Haider Abbas.
description_of_attack: Three gunmen on motorcycles shot at Misra in the afternoon.

name: Gauri Lankesh
journalist_body_of_work: Lankesh is known for her criticism of right-wing extremism and the establishment.
description_of_attack: Three unidentified assailants fired at Gauri Lankesh outside her home.
